question_sentence: Which coin was minted for the last time this week?
evidence: The last-ever penny was minted on Wednesday in Philadelphia. In February, President Donald Trump instructed the US Mint to stop making the coin, citing the cost of production.

question_sentence: The US government reopened on Wednesday after a bitter funding standoff. How long did the shutdown last?
evidence: The federal government is beginning to reopen its agencies after President Trump signed a bill to end the 43-day shutdown.

question_sentence: Which natural phenomenon lit up the sky this week, creating colorful displays visible across the world?
evidence: Millions saw unexpected northern lights as a wild solar storm unfolded across the world.

question_sentence: The US State Department issued an unusual warning for Americans in Japan this week. Which of the following were they told to watch out for?
evidence: The State Department issued a “wildlife alert” warning that bear sightings and attacks have increased in parts of northern Japan.

question_sentence: Which type of baby product was recently recalled across the US?
evidence: The baby formula company ByHeart recalled all of its formula products nationwide amid an infant botulism outbreak investigation.

question_sentence: Which country launched a "massive mobilization" of military personnel in response to the buildup of US warships in the region?
evidence: Venezuela announced a “massive mobilization” of military forces after the United States’ largest warship entered the region, further fueling tensions between the two countries.

question_sentence: Jack Schlossberg announced he is running for a House seat in New York City. Which former US president was his grandfather?
evidence: Jack Schlossberg, the grandson of former President John F. Kennedy, became JFK’s first direct descendant and latest member of his family to run for elected office.

question_sentence: Which severe weather event impacted much of the southern US this week?
evidence: Several parts of the southern US faced some of their coldest early-November temperatures in decades. More than two dozen cities, reaching as far south as Fort Myers, Miami and Naples, Florida, toppled or tied daily record lows this week. It was so cold in parts of the Sunshine State that iguanas fell from trees.

question_sentence: Which type of outbreak has been linked to recalled pasta meals sold at major grocery chains in the US?
evidence: More than two dozen people have been sickened and six have died in the latest listeria outbreak. The cases have been linked to recalled prepared meals at Albertsons, Kroger, Sprouts Farmers Market and Trader Joe’s.

question_sentence: Which federal holiday was celebrated in the US this week?
evidence: Veterans Day is observed annually in the US on November 11. Ceremonies and tributes were held across the country to honor the millions of men and women who have served in the US Armed Forces.
